from Columbia (the last in 1950), studying with John Hermann Randall and Paul Oscar Kristeller; he spent 1945–6 at Yale and studied with the Hume scholar Charles Hendel. He taught at the University of Connecticut, the University of Iowa, and the Claremont Colleges before forging a new department at the University of California, San Diego (1963–73) and then settling at Washington University, St Louis (1973–86).
